name: Undergraduate Researcher in the Digital Humanities Lab
description: Racial discrimination in access to housing, jobs, finance and health care has left a lasting mark on the US urban landscape. In Boston in 2015, the average White family‚Äôs assets amounted to $247,500. The average Black family‚Äôs assets totaled all of $8.00‚Äîthe price of two McDonald‚Äôs happy meals. We set out in this digital history lab to figure out at the neighborhood level how this great gap in wealth occurred. I worked on the housing page.

name: Undergraduate Researcher in the Digital Humanities Lab
description: Developed a 'sonification toolkit,' a flexible digital tools that will enable conversion of data sets (images, text, statistics) into sound in ways that quickly yield results. These tools will allow users to easily modify and adapt the ways the data is expressed to design and sculpt sound that is aesthetically satisfying and analytically illuminating. UROPs will define and develop a range of practices, then devise digital tools to quickly transform data sets of all types into a variety of sonified results.

name: SuperUROP - Responsible Regulating Social Media
description: Developed a policy that can test and quantify the effect of content curation on user learning
Built a recommendation system using content filtering and matrix factorization algorithms
Created learning agents to track the effect of different recommending systems on decision making

Abstract: Social Media Platforms (SMPs) use recommendations to provide userswith content [1].  Some standard recommendation techniques can nega-tively affect the way users learn and how much SMPs can profit.  Plat-forms can to have a greedy approach when recommending content to users,which can negatively affect learning and profits.  We align the platform‚Äôsgoals with gaining more money and user‚Äôs goals to learn freely by modify-ing how recommendation systems estimate and recommend to their users.We introduce a new approach for estimating user interests for topics tointroduce diversity and treat users as a learning agent rather than a staticuser.  We found a way that a SMP can focus on these goals to improveusers‚Äô learning experiences and make more profit than current approaches
